title: Usability Testing-Centered Instructional Design for Web-Based Writing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and foundational writing skills at the secondary education level
context.additional_context: Learner Role: Students/Job Seekers. Domain Expertise: Beginner. Delivery Mode: Asynchronous LMS. Assessment Method: Summative Assessment-Centric. Technology Environment: Digital Devices Provided.

learning_goals: Learners can perform a systematic writing process using at least three digital tools (writing templates, feedback systems, collaboration spaces) on web-based platforms
Learners can propose at least two interface improvement plans for online writing courses reflecting usability test results
Learners can understand and apply quantitative/qualitative feedback for writing assignments through peer assessment and automated evaluation systems at 80% or higher accuracy
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
